programme.title: Cuirm aig Celtic Connections | Valtos & Caraidean
programme.desc: 3/3. Valtos and friends in concert for Celtic Connections. Presented by Megan MacLellan.

programme.title: An Clo Mor
programme.desc: 1/4. Mill owner Seumas MacSween collapses. Tha an dàrna sreath a' tòiseachadh le brag agus ceannard na muilne, Seumas MacSuain, a' leigeil roimhe. A bheil e beò no marbh?

programme.title: Sruth
programme.desc: 4/8. Ceòl bho Lauren O'Neill, Ali Levack, Griogair Labhruidh agus Niall Vallely. Music from Lauren O'Neill, Ali Levack, Griogair Labhruidh and Niall Vallely.

programme.title: Stuart Burrows Sings
programme.desc: In a programme that first aired in 1986, celebrated Welsh tenor Stuart Burrows is joined by Karita Mattila, a young Aled Jones, The Pendyrus Male Choir and Beverley Humphreys.

programme.title: A Concerto for Evelyn
programme.desc: From the 1992 BBC Proms, the premiere of James MacMillan's concerto for percussion and orchestra, Veni, Veni, Emmanuel, composed for Evelyn Glennie.

programme.title: Evelyn Glennie: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: 8/8. The world's leading classical solo percussionist Evelyn Glennie talks to John Wilson about her career and picks out some of the key influences on her artistic path.

programme.title: Maurice Ravel
programme.desc: Documentary about French composer Maurice Ravel (1875-1937), narrated by John Abineri and featuring performances of his work by Jill Gomez, Osian Ellis, Edward Beckett and others.

programme.title: Britain 's Most Fragile Treasure
programme.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez unlocks the secrets of a centuries-old masterpiece in glass, the Great East Window at York Minster, the largest expanse of medieval stained glass in the UK.

programme.title: A Voice for the World: Stuart Burrows
programme.desc: A profile from 1977 of the late Welsh tenor Stuart Burrows, who achieved international acclaim in the opera houses and concert halls of the world.

programme.desc: Andrew 'Freddie' Flintoff hosts the game show as 24 waterlogged contestants get ready for a full on face-plant in the Med, but who will get their hands on the Cannonball Cup?

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britain's most talented detectives tackle a dangerous arsonist in Bristol, a drug smuggling operation in Manchester, and a family committing shocking animal cruelty in Cheshire.

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Special police task forces tackle a brutal stabbing of a 16-year-old boy in Preston two days before Christmas, and Northamptonshire police target a drug-dealing gang on an estate.

programme.title: Trawlermen: Hunting the Catch
programme.desc: The Race: The crew of Karen of Ladram hunts hake off of Cornwall, a rookie crew works in the Irish Sea, and trainee skipper Michael steps up in a storm.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: Rick Stein's culinary odyssey ends in Istanbul, where he arrives in time for the bluefish season and catches a few himself while fishing on the Bosphorus.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Leeds: Auction warfare in the wheeler-dealer reality series. Tensions run high as the Americans come to town. A pig skin and a suit of armour are among the goods up for grabs.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Birmingham: Cut-throat bidding as savvy storage experts battle for lucrative lots. Helium, horses and a box of inflatables are all up for grabs, while Nat and John clash.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Royston: Sparks fly in the confrontational reality series - quite literally this time, as a storage bin goes up in smoke! A mystery object under tarpaulin causes a catfight.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motoring news and controversial views. Jeremy drives the smallest car ever made and Richard races a Bugatti Veyron against the RAF's Typhoon jet fighter. Ronnie Wood guests.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: High-speed high-jinks - and high trousers - with Clarkson and co, who are joined by pop mogul Simon Cowell. The lads race each other across London using a bike, a boat and a car.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: (2003) Kevin Costner's western with Robert Duvall and Michael Gambon. A small band of free grazers are forced to take on a local rancher and his hired thugs.

programme.title: Genova
programme.desc: (2008) Supernatural drama. A widower (Colin Firth) takes his daughters to Italy to find some solace for their loss, but once there, their memories are dangerously stirred. Strong language.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: Suffragette Interview Special
programme.desc: Writer Abi Morgan, director Sarah Gavron and star Anne-Marie Duff talk about their powerful period political drama Suffragette.

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: (1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.

programme.title: The Man from Laramie
programme.desc: (1955) Classic western. James Stewart plays a stranger who arrives in a remote New Mexico town secretly seeking his brother's killer. With Donald Crisp, Alex Nicol and Arthur Kennedy.

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: (2015) Drama exploring the increasingly defiant campaign by British women for equality and the right to vote in the years before WWI. Starring Carey Mulligan and Meryl Streep.

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: (2005) Violent action-thriller starring Jason Statham as the tough courier Frank Martin, who's hired to guard a government drugs czar's son. But his mission soon lurches towards disaster.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
programme.desc: (2015) Part five of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The secret agents must bring down a terrorist group, but that's not easy when the CIA are hunting you down...

programme.title: Fantasy Island
programme.desc: (2020) Horror with Michael Peña, Lucy Hale and Maggie Q, inspired by the 70s TV series. Five visitors to a luxury island are promised their wildest desires - but there are conditions...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy
programme.desc: (1959) Wartime drama with Stanley Baker. The captain of a British army patrol deciphers secret enemy battle plans, but does so at a great moral cost.

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the...
programme.desc: ...Neighborhood: (2019) Biographical drama starring Tom Hanks as 'Mister' Rogers, the much-loved host of a kids TV show, who becomes the subject of a cynical journalist's article on heroes.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: (1999) Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts star in the hugely popular comedy romance about a bookshop owner who manages to get a glamorous movie star to go out with him. With Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: The Burnt Orange Heresy
programme.desc: (2019) Artworld thriller with Mick Jagger and Donald Sutherland. An art lecturer and his girlfriend are tasked with making a reclusive artist an offer he can't refuse.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural thriller and standalone sequel to 1996's The Craft. A teenager discovers that she has magical abilities. But they come with dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Emperor's New Clothes
programme.desc: (2001) Ian Holm plays both the exiled Napoleon, eager to return to glory, and the lowly sailor who takes his place in jail, both of whose lives and ambitions take very unexpected turns...

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: (1951) Classic Ealing thriller filmed in a documentary style, starring Bonar Colleano as a sailor whose smuggling activities lead to him being suspected of murder and going on the run.

programme.title: Belle
programme.desc: (2014) Amma Asante's powerful fact-based drama about Britain's first Black aristocrat. Gugu Mbatha-Raw portrays the extraordinary Dido Belle. Featuring Matthew Goode and Tom Wilkinson.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: The Transporter

programme.desc: (1958) Western. Van Heflin stars as a veteran frontiersman whose determination to mould his sons in his gun-totin' image backfires disastrously. With Tab Hunter and James Darren.

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the...
programme.desc: ...Neighborhood: (2019) Biographical drama starring Tom Hanks as 'Mister' Rogers, the much-loved host of a kids TV show, who becomes the subject of a cynical journalist's article on heroes.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: (1999) Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts star in the hugely popular comedy romance about a bookshop owner who manages to get a glamorous movie star to go out with him. With Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: The Burnt Orange Heresy
programme.desc: (2019) Artworld thriller with Mick Jagger and Donald Sutherland. An art lecturer and his girlfriend are tasked with making a reclusive artist an offer he can't refuse.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural thriller and standalone sequel to 1996's The Craft. A teenager discovers that she has magical abilities. But they come with dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Emperor's New Clothes
programme.desc: (2001) Ian Holm plays both the exiled Napoleon, eager to return to glory, and the lowly sailor who takes his place in jail, both of whose lives and ambitions take very unexpected turns...

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: (1966) Dark comedy with John Mills, Ralph Richardson and Michael Caine. Two brothers clash over money that their parents left to their last surviving child, with chaotic consequences.

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: (1951) Classic Ealing thriller filmed in a documentary style, starring Bonar Colleano as a sailor whose smuggling activities lead to him being suspected of murder and going on the run.

programme.title: Belle
programme.desc: (2014) Amma Asante's powerful fact-based drama about Britain's first Black aristocrat. Gugu Mbatha-Raw portrays the extraordinary Dido Belle. Featuring Matthew Goode and Tom Wilkinson.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Beverley Callard, Kirsty Gallacher and Stephen K Amos 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, Sophia and her husband James from Surrey, Welsh couple Rhydian and Jamie, and junior doctor Becky and her mum Julie from Leeds try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Mario from Ipswich, Emma originally from Barnsley, Jacqueline from Surrey and Greg from Nottingham pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Liam makes a discovery. while Robert's suspicions are piqued and Pollard tells Mack the truth

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ryan worries about Debbie's behaviour at work, Dev absolves Aadi of any guilt for the robbery, Lou asks a massive favour of Sally, and Billy overhears Theo lying to an old friend

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the police investigation into the crimes of serial killer Peter Sutcliffe, known as the Yorkshire Ripper, and the missed opportunities to charge him for his earlier, unacknowledged crimes. This episode explores the murders of Judith Roberts in 1972 and Carol Wilkinson in 1977, and the two innocent men who were mistakenly charged with their killings

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genève in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks. There was also drama in Italy's last-eight contest, which saw them claim a 2-1 win against Norway, with star striker Cristiana Girelli completing her brace in second-half stoppage time

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: From the Ground Up
programme.desc: Documentary following Ian Wright's involvement in launching a girls' team at his childhood club Ten Em Bee

programme.title: Ainsley's Taste of Malta
programme.desc: The chef explores the south of Malta, beginning in Marsaxlokk where he visits the weekly fish market before heading to a nearby vineyard to hear all about the vines. After a game of Bocchi with the locals, a baker teaches Ainsley the history of the traditional Maltese bake and he takes a trip to a potato farm to find out what makes them such a popular export

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain is in turmoil, while John reaches out and Kim is furious

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Todd's fears for Theo prompt him to lash out at Noah, Ryan reminds Debbie of his noble intentions, Sam vanishes from Audrey's birthday meal, and Dev's clumsy remark upsets Lauren

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of a woman's quest to discover her identity, and another searching for the sister she always wanted. Paula Stillie has always looked completely different from her white adoptive family in Scotland and her search for her birth family leads across the globe, while Lisa Harding tries to fulfil her mother's dying wish and find the older sister who was given up for adoption before Lisa was born

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: The Assembly
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker gets the grilling of a lifetime as he faces questions from autistic and learning-disabled interviewers, asking if he was forced out by the BBC and who the worst person he has worked with is. From the Hand of God to his first love, no question is off the table and no subject out of bounds when it comes to the Assembly's line of enquiry - expect revelations, chaos, and a lot of laughs

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first semi-final, which comes from Stade de Genève in Switzerland. England continue their defence of the title after they came through a nail-biting quarter-final with Sweden, fighting back from 2-0 down to take the match to penalties and winning the shootout 3-2 despite failing to score four of their spot kicks.
